title: Grammar: Complex Sentences and Clauses

vocab.definition: Sentence with one independent clause and at least one dependent clause
Group of words that can stand alone as a complete sentence
Group of words that cannot stand alone as a sentence
Word that connects dependent clause to independent clause
Pronoun that introduces relative clauses (who, which, that)

teachingNotes: Practice identifying and creating complex sentences. Focus on proper punctuation with dependent clauses.

sample.question: What is a complex sentence?
expectedAny: sentence with one independent and one dependent clause
sentence with independent and dependent clauses

sample.question: What is an independent clause?
expectedAny: group of words that can stand alone

sample.question: What is a dependent clause?
expectedAny: group of words that cannot stand alone

sample.question: What is a subordinating conjunction?
expectedAny: word that connects dependent to independent clause

sample.question: Give an example of a subordinating conjunction.
Can an independent clause stand alone?
Can a dependent clause stand alone?
How many independent clauses are in a complex sentence?

truefalse.question: An independent clause can stand alone as a complete sentence. (True or False)
A dependent clause can stand alone as a sentence. (True or False)
A complex sentence has one independent and one dependent clause. (True or False)
Subordinating conjunctions connect dependent clauses. (True or False)
Who, which, and that are relative pronouns. (True or False)
A complex sentence must have two independent clauses. (True or False)
Because is a subordinating conjunction. (True or False)
All clauses can stand alone. (True or False)
A dependent clause is also called a subordinate clause. (True or False)
A complex sentence is simpler than a simple sentence. (True or False)

fillintheblank.question: A group of words that cannot stand alone is a _____ clause.

Who, which, and that are _____ pronouns.
Because, although, and when are _____ conjunctions.

shortanswer.question: What makes a clause independent?
expectedAny: It can stand alone as a complete sentence
An independent clause is complete on its own
It expresses a complete thought and can stand alone

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between independent and dependent clauses?
expectedAny: Independent clauses can stand alone but dependent clauses cannot
Independent clauses are complete but dependent clauses are incomplete
Independent clauses express complete thoughts while dependent clauses do not

shortanswer.question: Give an example of a complex sentence.
expectedAny: Although it rained, we went outside
I stayed home because I was sick
When the bell rings, class begins

shortanswer.question: What role do subordinating conjunctions play?
expectedAny: They connect dependent clauses to independent clauses
Subordinating conjunctions join dependent and independent clauses
They show the relationship between dependent and independent clauses

shortanswer.question: What are relative pronouns used for?
expectedAny: Relative pronouns connect relative clauses to nouns
They start clauses that describe nouns

shortanswer.question: Why is a dependent clause called dependent?
expectedAny: It depends on an independent clause to make sense
It cannot stand alone and needs another clause
It is incomplete without an independent clause

shortanswer.question: How do you identify a complex sentence?
expectedAny: Look for one independent and at least one dependent clause
Find a sentence with a subordinating conjunction joining clauses
Identify sentences with both independent and dependent clauses

shortanswer.question: What punctuation is often used with dependent clauses?
expectedAny: A comma when the dependent clause comes first
Use a comma after a dependent clause at the beginning

shortanswer.question: How does a complex sentence differ from a simple sentence?
expectedAny: Complex sentences have multiple clauses while simple sentences have one
Simple sentences have one independent clause but complex have dependent clauses too
Complex sentences are more detailed with dependent clauses added
